pageContext.claim: “There is no bribery, or any crime at all, alleged in the Articles of Impeachment. This is a first in the history of our Country.”
pageContext.analysis: Congress has impeached presidents for a variety of offenses that might not ordinarily be considered "crimes." Andrew Johnson, for instance was impeached for, among other items, having made "with a loud voice, certain intemperate, inflammatory, and scandalous harangues, and did therein utter loud threats and bitter menaces ... against Congress [and] the laws of the United States duly enacted thereby, amid the cries, jeers and laughter of the multitudes then assembled and within bearing." That sounds almost like a Trump rally.
